alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 11:54AM EDT until July 14 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following county, Okaloosa. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban areas is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1053 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms repeatedly moving over the same locations. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall is expected through this afternoon as more storms drift across the county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wright, Fort Walton Beach, Mary Esther, Ocean City, Cinco Bayou and Wynnehaven Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
